name: HTMLImageElement
description: The HTMLImageElement interface provides special properties and methods  for manipulating the layout and presentation of elements.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.align
members.description: Is a DOMString indicating the alignment of the image with respect to the surrounding context. The possible values are "left", "right", "justify", and "center".

members.name: HTMLImageElement.alt
members.description: Is a DOMString that reflects the alt HTML attribute,  thus indicating fallback context for the image.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.border
members.description: Is a DOMString that is responsible for the width of the border surrounding the image. This is now deprecated and the CSS border property should be used instead.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.complete
members.description: Returns a Boolean that is true if the browser has finished fetching the image, whether successful or not. It also shows true, if the image has no src value.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.crossOrigin
members.description: Is a DOMString representing the CORS setting for this image element. See CORS settings attributes for further details.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.currentSrc
members.description: Returns a DOMString representing the URL to the currently displayed image (which may change, for example in response to media queries).

members.name: HTMLImageElement.height
members.description: Is a unsigned long that reflects the height HTML attribute, indicating the rendered height of the image in CSS pixels.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.hspace
members.description: Is a long representing the space on either side of the image.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.isMap
members.description: Is a Boolean that reflects the ismap HTML attribute, indicating that the image is part of a server-side image map.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.longDesc
members.description: Is a DOMString representing the URI of a long description of the image.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.lowSrc
members.description: Is a DOMString that refers to a low-quality (but faster to load) copy of the image.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.name
members.description: Is a DOMString representing the name of the element.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.naturalHeight
members.description: Returns a unsigned long representing the intrinsic height of the image in CSS pixels, if it is available; else, it shows 0.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.naturalWidth
members.description: Returns a unsigned long representing the intrinsic width of the image in CSS pixels, if it is available; otherwise, it will show 0.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.referrerPolicy
members.description: Is a DOMString that reflects the referrerpolicy HTML attribute indicating which referrer to use in order to fetch the image.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.src
members.description: Is a DOMString that reflects the src HTML attribute, containing the full URL of the image including base URI.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.sizes
members.description: Is a DOMString reflecting the sizes HTML attribute.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.srcset
members.description: Is a DOMString reflecting the srcset HTML attribute, containing a list of candidate images, separated by a comma (',', U+002C COMMA). A candidate image is a URL followed by a 'w' with the width of the images, or an 'x' followed by the pixel density.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.useMap
members.description: Is a DOMString that reflects the usemap HTML attribute, containing a partial URL of a map element.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.vspace
members.description: Is a long representing the space above and below the image.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.width
members.description: Is a unsigned long that reflects the width HTML attribute, indicating the rendered width of the image in CSS pixels.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.x
members.description: Returns a long representing the horizontal offset from the nearest layer. This property mimics an old Netscape 4 behavior.

members.name: HTMLImageElement.y
members.description: Returns a long representing the vertical offset from the nearest layer. This property is also similar to behavior of an old Netscape 4.

members.name: Image()
members.description: The Image() constructor, taking two optional unsigned long, which are the width and the height of the resource, creates an instance of HTMLImageElement , not inserted in a DOM tree.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the image (i.e. the value for the width attribute).

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the image (i.e. the value for the height attribute).
